article:
Do you have a nickname ?Most of us get one from our _ ,way of dressing,or personality.But for cities,the meaning of their nicknames has _ more to it than that.
Many big cities have _ ,like New York--The Big Apple,London--The Great Smog,and
Rome--The Eternal City.Why do cities have these nicknames?
 _ the 1920s,there were many races in New York.People called the _ of these races apples.A famous writer first called New York the Big Apple, _ New York is a place where many people would like to visit:the biggest prize of all.
For Rome,just like its name,the answer is clear.Romans _ that no matter what happened to the world,Rome would _ go on.Rome has been an important center in the world for more than 2,000 years.
As for London,in the Victorian period(1837--1901),it had _ with its air. Later in 1952,serious air pollution made 10,000 people _ ill.But now the air of London has become better.Some people even say the air pollution in Beijing now is like that 0f Victorian London.
Sound interesting? Does your city have a nickname?
